title: Intermediate English 306
headline: Master phrasal verbs, the perfect present continuous tense and vocabulary related to dating in this free online course.
description: This course introduces you to vocabulary related to dating, used to discuss your relationships. In the grammar section, master how to form phrasal verbs correctly and discover how to use the present perfect continuous tense. We will explore how to use reflexive and reciprocal pronouns and teach you the difference between the present perfect and present perfect continuous tense when talking about continuous actions. Enroll today!
courseDescription:
Forming relationships with other people is a part of our very nature as human beings. While every culture has its customs, rules, and traditions when it comes to forming relationships, we all have the ability to connect with other people. Thus, we designed this course to teach you the basic vocabulary to understand and discuss relationships and dating. You will start by learning different verbs to help you converse about dating and pursuing romantic relationships. You will then learn how to identify different types of relationships to explain the kinds of relationships you are in.

After learning these new words, you will study two grammar sections. The first section will focus on forming phrasal verbs in the present, past, and future tenses. You will then understand the difference between transitive and intransitive phrasal verbs and identify the difference between separable and inseparable phrasal verbs. In addition, you will learn how to form questions with phrasal verbs using a variety of tenses. We will introduce you to reflective and reciprocal pronouns, and you will learn how to differentiate between them. The second grammar section will focus on the present perfect continuous tense. You will explore how continuous and recent actions have results in the present, and then learn to identify the difference between the present perfect and the present perfect continuous tenses to indicate continuous actions.

This course's final section has been designed to help you integrate and develop your new grammar and vocabulary skills. You will practice reading, listening, speaking, and writing using what you have discovered about dating, relationships, phrasal verbs, and the present perfect continuous tense. Start this course today to further your English proficiency, help you discuss your dating and relationship experiences, and communicate your views with others!
